intro: Guarea pubescens subsp. pubiflora, commonly known as the hairy guarea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its rough, bark-like trunk and large, palmate leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by woody, globose fruits containing several seeds. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
